meanings.definition: Able to be seen from a distance.
meanings.sent1: The tall tower was easily intervisible from the neighboring town.
meanings.sent2: The bright lighthouse was intervisible along the coast.
meanings.sent3: The intervisible mountain peaks seemed to wave at each other in the distance.
meanings.sent4: The intervisible stars in the night sky formed a beautiful pattern.
meanings.sent5: The intervisible landmarks helped the travelers navigate the vast desert.

meanings.definition: Capable of being observed or perceived.
meanings.sent1: The intricate details of the painting were intervisible upon closer inspection.
meanings.sent2: The subtle changes in the landscape were intervisible to the keen eye.
meanings.sent3: The intervisible clues led the detective to solve the mystery.
meanings.sent4: The intervisible emotions on her face revealed her true feelings.
meanings.sent5: The intervisible footprints in the snow indicated someone had passed by.

meanings.sent1: The two houses were intervisible across the valley.
meanings.sent2: The classrooms were intervisible through the open windows.
meanings.sent3: The intervisible neighbors often waved to each other from their yards.
meanings.sent4: The intervisible islands in the sea created a picturesque view.
meanings.sent5: The intervisible planets in the night sky fascinated the astronomers.
